basics.name: Santipab Tipparach
basics.label: Web Application and Games Developer
basics.summary: Ruben (Santipab) grew up living in Thailand and the US, his two greatest dreamns are of going to space and making video games. He has a full time hobby of developing fun, immersive virtual reality games where him and his team have won multiple awards. He also comes from the world of web application development, where he has been employed in various industries, such as Civil Engineering, Power Grid Transimission, and most recently the Manufacturing of Windows and Doors.

work.summary: Founded group to develop VR content for commercial games and for local organizations and busnisses. Worked as lead on the Fleet Hackers VR project, served as lead writer, programmer, and art design. Developed VR tools for motion capture, ragdoll systems, and robotic sensor controls. Prototyped many games including Ixion and Tower of the Sun for HTC Vive.
highlights: Won many local awards for outstanding innovation and creativity in the local Fargo/Moorhead Area
Held the championship for Fargo Game Makers 2 Years in a row.
Continue to spread VR education among Fargo youth, and advocate for VR development.

work.summary: Design, implement solutions, and maintain the main SCADA database as well as writing custom scripts and functionality for Ignition system. Provide support for 4 manufacturing facilities for the Integrity and Infinity line of Windows and Doors productions.
highlights: Leaded the adoption of DevOps, Continuous Integration, Distributed Version Control Systems, and created Development and Testing environments for SCADA Systems
Designed and implemented data structures and interfaces for storing PLC/Machine data to take snapshots of configurations for multiple batches of parts.

work.summary: Employed as a teaching assistant for the computer science department in CS 160. Then trasitioned into a Resarch assistant for the Upper Great Plains Transportation Institute(UGPTI). Maintained databases, legacy code, and successfully lead the development multiple new product releases for the DOT(Department of Transprotation) and UGPTI offices.
highlights: Worked on realtime data capture of roadway conditions using an Android device.
Developed a new version of the Geographic Roadway Inventory Tool with ReactJS, Semantic UI, and Node JS.

work.summary: Employed as a professional developer creating software for the one of the country's largest energy industry software company. Developed solutions to schedule transmissions of electrical energy and made strides in advancing the company in automated testing, and application-to-application communication infratructures.
highlights: Lead developer of the Realtime Net-Scheduled Interchange application for monitoring real-time and near future transmissions across power grids.
Lead development on integration of inter-company data transfer using SOAP XML via TSL.
Improved testing infrastructure by creating Unit Tests in NUnit and training new QA teams for automation of Unit Tests.

work.summary: Worked as a software developer. Created a scheduling program, and a GIS application that interfaced with Google Earth. In addition, also designed 3D models for engineering projects, or future development plans. Used 3Ds Max and Gimp to develop a photo-realistic demonstration of the Bemidji Airport existing and development sites, along with a virtual tour of the Bemidji Airport for potential investors, landscape developers, and Civil Engineers.

volunteer.summary: Helped with Unity, VR, and Game Maker education program for middle school students grades 6-8. Taught kids to develop games using C# and Game Maker scripting.

volunteer.organization: West Fargo Public Schools STEM Program
volunteer.summary: Helped bring game development education to a larger audience of students with 2D and VR video games in Unity.
Ran a boot camp for VR devleopment for young adults. Used Coogle Cardboard and Android phones to create a VR balloon popping game.
Ran the Twitch stream for the FIRST robotics competition.

awards.title: 1st Prize at Fargo Game Jam 2018
awards.summary: The development of Tower of the Sun, an interactive social simulation game about a society that solves its problems with sacrifices.

awards.title: 1st Place at the Fargo Hackathon 2018
awards.summary: For the development of Storm of Fire, and education simulation about fire safety.

awards.title: 2nd Place at the Fargo Hackathon 2017
awards.summary: For the driving and zombie-fighting simulation using the Wrld API and Fargo Fire Department data.

awards.title: 1st Prize at Fargo Game Jam 2017
awards.summary: Development of the prototype space horror survival game Ixion.

awards.title: 3rd place at the Innovation Challenge NDSU 2017
awards.summary: For the development of Fleet Hackers - and immersive VR space simulation.

publications.name: BeachBot: Crowdsourcing Garbage Collection with Amphibious Robot Network
An interconnected network of UAS as a system-of-systems

skills.name: General Programming
keywords: Java, Android Development, Map Reduce with Hadoop
